data.chText: 趋势；趋向；倾向；动态；动向
data.enText: a general direction in which a situation is changing or developing

data.chText: 经济 / 社会 / 政治趋势
提早退休者有增加的趋势。
data.enText: There is a growing trend towards earlier retirement.

data.chText: 销售额下滑 / 上升的趋势
data.enText: a downward/an upward trend in sales

data.chText: 看来你们是开了一个新风气。
data.enText: You seem to have set (= started) a new trend .

data.chText: 这种倾向正在向相反的方向转变。
data.enText: This trend is being reversed (= is going in the opposite direction) .

data.chText: 其中一个地区正试图挡住经济衰退的趋势。
data.enText: One region is attempting to buck (= oppose or resist) the trend of economic decline.

data.chText: 通货膨胀的潜在趋势仍然是上升的。
data.enText: The underlying trend of inflation is still upwards.

ex.zh: 令人不安的趋势（或风尚）

tr: the popular taste at a given time
example: the 1920s had a style of their own

tr: a general tendency to change (as of opinion)
example: not openly liberal but that is the trend of the book
a broad movement of the electorate to the right
the river takes a southern course
the northeastern trend of the coast

tr: a general direction in which something tends to move
example: the shoreward tendency of the current
the trend of the stock market
The car cut to the left at the intersection
The motorbike veered to the right

value.def: A trend is a change or development towards something new or different.

example.tran: 倾向于兼职就业的趋势

value.def: To set a trend means to do something that becomes accepted or fashionable, and that a lot of other people copy.

example.ex: The record has already proved a success and may well start a trend.
example.tran: 该唱片已证明大获成功，并且很可能会引导潮流。

trans: 趨勢分析；时间趋势分析；趋向分析；趋势分析；趋势分析法
跟随潮流；跟着趋势走；跟风；当趋势的跟屁虫；跟随趋势
趋势线；走势线；趋向线；走向线；线图中走势线
共同趋势；共同趋势模型；共同趋势法
趋势增长率；长期成长率
长期趋势；长期变异；变化趋势；久趋向
